Reviews.Title: “The most horrible hotel I've ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: ido1979il
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, but that's the only good thing about this hotel. The bed was very uncomfortable. The TV didn't work. The internet connection was very slow and crashed every 15 minutes. The breakfast was very poor. I stayed there in the summer, it was impossible to stay in the room during day time because it was hot as hell and it was impossible to open the window! The worst thing is the staff: they were so tough and never smiled, as if they were military officers. When I tried to explain to the receptionist that I was very unsatisfied with the hotel, the uncomfortable bed, the very hot room, bad internet connection and bad breakfast, she didn't even want to listen. She refused to let me speak to the manager and she said I can always go to another hotel. That's exactly what I will do in my next visit in Berlin, and that's what you should do too. Stay away from that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Basic Basic”
Reviews.Author: menash14
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in the end of November. the staff was very welcoming though their English wasn't great, which was actually the case all over town in some places while being horrific in restaurants... The hotel was ok, the room was cleaned and tidied daily, not very much else to say, there was a small TV which only showed German channels.. Breakfast was included, and was pretty good, though it was the same stuff all week long, even on the weekend. One big no no for me was the lack of free WiFi, you had to pay 2euro per hour or 7euro for a whole day.. so keep that in mind if you're coming here. Nice hotel for the price and the location is pretty good, but I think the mitte area is better for young people coming to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly personal”
Reviews.Author: alaska088
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent - all tipes of transport are just minutes from it. Famous Berlin ZOO is just opposite. We went there to see as much of Berlin sights as possible and we succeeded fully! It's due to friendly and effective staff! Especially we want to thank receptionists Olga and Vika, who helped us to find the most interesting places to visit! Breakfasts also were good and rooms were clean. Katja & Sergei from Riga

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel in Central Location”
Reviews.Author: holidaybugSwindon
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a 7 day stay because we had to stay in Berlin unexpectedly for another week. We wanted cheap and chearful and thats what we got. We had a twin room with basin, very small. The shower and toliets were down the corridor, but as other rooms on our floor had en-suite we never saw anyone else using them. The hotel is staffed with Russians so launguage was sometimes a problem. The buffet breakfast was just the job, we made up rolls for the day too. Wifi was way over priced so had to visit local cafes with free internet. Overall great location and good value if you require more privacy than a hostel but very basic accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Nami871
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute so didn't really have a lot of choice of budget options in central Berlin! The hotel was very good though - did exactly what it said on the tin - no frills simple room which was clean and comfortable. We went for no ensuite as it was cheaper but there was a sink in the room which was useful. The shared shower and toilets were impeccably clean and modern - we were glad we didn't pay the extra EUR15 a night she tried to persuade us to on check-in for ensuite! They also put on a fantastic breakfast in the morning - bread, ham, cheese, cereal, stollen, juices, fruit - more than I expected. Location wise it is pretty good depending on what you are looking for. Being next to KaDeWe and the Kudamm was great - although very quiet in the evening. We were there for Mauerfall 09, so spent most of our time heading east towards Brandenburg Tor - although late night U-Bahn connections made sure it was very easy to get back. You are also close to Zoologsicher Platz with direct trains to the Airport so it is very well connected. All in all, a very good budget option and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: WorldwiseHouston_Tx
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel near train station in center of town. Check in was easy and Russian lady was helpful with directions. Room with private bathroom, two twin beds. Radiator worked well and room was comfortable. Plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. Window opened to allow air in. Included small tv and closet. Bathroom was small but worked ok.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyRabbit
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as it was recommended by a friend but if I had known what it was really like I would have given it a pass. I booked the room with a bathroom and as stated in the 2008 reviews it is really basic so all you get is a room with a bathroom (no frills). There is no air conditioning in the room so I had to rely on an open window for fresh air, only the window just tilts forward a little. There are better hotels closer to the main parts of town which cost the same or close to the price you pay for this so called hotel which is more like a hostel just do your research or go the the tourist information and tell them what budget and where and they can help you book a room for a small fee (EU$4).

Reviews.Title: “Clean but basic”
Reviews.Author: CarlaCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on previous TripAdvisor reviewers, who highlighted Hotel Ansbach's excellent location and cleanliness. They had also said that the rooms were basic, so I was not expecting frills. The hotel was everything previously stated: everywhere was immaculate, room and bathroom included. The room itself was very bare, just 2 single beds, a table with 2 backless chairs and a night table. As I was using the hotel as a base to sleep, this posed no problem. The venetian blind didn't shut and the curtains were see-through, but luckily, I was on the fifth floor and felt safe from prospective peeping toms. The little bathroom was a nice surprise: white-tiled with modern appliances, although the shower was not very powerful. The breakfast buffet was generous and the coffee was excellent. All in all, I got what I paid for - a budget hotel. The 2 bonuses were its location and its spotlessness.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from City Hotel Ansbach”
Reviews.Author: SwissFrench
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time in Berlin and at Hotel Ansbach and will never go to this hotel again. FIRST DAY: very noisy! My room was at the second floor next to the housekeeping room and someone was slamming the door every five minutes! I could not sleep or just relax in the afternoon. I kindly asked the young lady not to slam the door (who previously rushed in my room without knocking at the door -- I was half naked!!), she apologized... 10 minutes later : BAM BAM BAM! . I returned to the housekeeping room: there was a man (I tried to explain the problem but no one in this hotel except at the reception speak English, they speak German of course and Russian, so good luck!) SECOND DAY: At the breakfest lounge: I asked if there were some hot milk. A very unpleasant person coldly answered: "THERE!" (there was some cold milk only...) After breakfast I went back to my room. "BAM, BAM!" every five minutes! I returned fot the third time to the housekepping room and asked for silence! Another lady apologized but a few hours later : "BAM, BAM" !!! A real nightmare. Finally I decided to explain the problem to a nice lady at the reception, who kindly wrote a paper in Russian for the housekeepers... (the only pleasant and polite person in this hotel...) THIRD DAY (the day I'm writing this review from my room): I spend the whole night out of the hotel and arrived this morning. I kindly asked the receptionnist --another lady I had never seen before-- if it was possible just to change the towels in the bathroom, and not to make my bed as I wanted to sleep the whole day and not to be disturbed by the housekeeper. She was VERY unpleasant -- not even a smile -- and told me that customers had to keep their towels which were not supposed to be changed every day!! I found this very strange for a hotel, also because their towels are very small and thin, and I replied to the lady that in hotels, customers put the towels on the floor to say "please change the towels". She seemed completely unaware of this custom... She coldly replied "ok for this time" (...) I will never return to this hotel also because they have absolutely no consideration for returning customers. I was so annoyed by their attitude that yesterday after lunch, that I decided to visit a small hotel in the same street (Ansbacher Strasse) for my next trip to Berlin and asked if I could have a look at one room : people were very kind, and were offering a single room for almost the same price!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Estonian_girl
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, being next to KaDeWe (posh & biggest department store in mainland Europe, think Harrods & make sure u try their champignons!) and the Zoo. Bahnhof Zoo station has enjoyed a bad image due to drug trade but the hotel location is perefectly fine and I really enjoyed my night-time walks. After all, it's a minute or 2 away from Europa-Center shopping, Ku'damm with all the designer shops and in the heart of Berlin. You also have a tube station on the street and the nearby Zoo station is the centre of Berlin traffic, so you can easily go anywhere, although a lot of sights are within walking distance. Conveniently for tourists, tourist information is also nearby - you could wish for nothing more in terms of location. The hotel itself is nice, with a friendly Eastern European receptionist, and there is nothing to complain about concerning the rooms. I saw the memorial church from my window and it was really quiet at night! The guests are a mix of budget travellers - Italian and French pernsioners, German school groups etc and the breakfast buffet is enjoyable. There is a spa on the top floor of the building next-door which may be worth checking out, and I really enjoyed my late cups of Turkish tea opposite in Cafe Ansbach, which is incredibly cheap. For a gourmet experience, try KaDeWe 7th floor. I really felt sorry when leaving cos I felt like home, like a true Berliner. I've been back many times since! All in all: good opportunity to save on accomodation without losing in quality and enjoy a luxurious holiday in great surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Families”
Reviews.Author: Lancsman1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the City Hotel-Ansbach for 3 nights during October 2006. We booked an apartment for 5 people (2 adults and 3 children) and got two rooms with an interconnecting hall and a bathroom at a price of 450 euros. The rooms were fairly basic although clean and comfortable. They were sparsely decorated and furnished and had blinds on the windows rather than curtains. The blinds didn't close properly so there wasn't a feeling of total privacy. The rooms didn't have tea/coffee making facilities although there were vending machines on two of the floors. The website states that the hotel has a bar, which it doesn't although you can buy cold beers out of the vending machine. On one of the nights the vending machine was empty. Our main reasons for booking this hotel were price and location and we were happy with both. The location, close to the Zoo and the Tiergarten is ideal for many attractions. Would we stay there again-possibly if travelling with children and wanting somewhere cheap and central to stay but otherwise, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Useful Location”
Reviews.Author: Neil_in_Sheffield_UK
Reviews.Content: Cold War Berlin had two city centres - one in the west and the other in the older eastern part of the city. The Ansbach is in the old western centre and it is very usefully located - near to the Zoo station and the impressive Ka De We department store - allegedly the biggest in Europe. Ansbacher Strasse is pretty quiet. The hotel is clean and comfortable but there's no bar or sociable reception area - it's in off the street and up in the lift. The breakfast room is on the first floor and the breakfast buffet was pretty good - boiled eggs, fresh rolls, nice coffee, yoghurt, apple juice etc.. I paid around £47 a night for a single room which contained two twin beds. The inviting mistiness of the hotel's website photos is replaced by a more austere reality but it's fine for a city centre hotel when all you really want is a peaceful, clean place to sleep with breakfast and a hot shower in the morning before exploring this exciting city which is still developing and still redefining itself.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ansbach
HotelInfo.Address: Ansbacher Strasse 4, 10787 Berlin, Germany
